snippet: The 1997 “Bodies of Subversion,” about women and tattoos, is being updated, and a traveling exhibition in Australia features the work of the tattoo artist Norman Collins.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; 1997 Bodies of Subversion exhibit about women and tattoos is being updated, and a traveling exhibition in Australia features the work of the tattoo artist Norman Collins; Sarah Evans collection of works by William Secord is showing in a preview; pieces are increasingly emerging of Mahogany furniture made in 18th-century Newport, RI.
lead_paragraph: The 1997 “Bodies of Subversion,” about women and tattoos, is being updated, and a traveling exhibition in Australia features the work of the tattoo artist Norman Collins.

headline.seo: Tattoos in More Books and Films; Dog Art at William Secord
headline.main: Tattoos’ Impressions in Print and in Film
headline.print_headline:
Tattoos’ Impressions
In Print and in Film
